oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Marine Jeff Montgomery to Ruth Hopper
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Jeff Montgomery, USMC, wrote this letter to his future wife Ruth Hopper in Jackson, Tennessee. Montgomery had just arrived for training at the Marine Corps Barracks on Parris Island. He enlisted only a few weeks before the armistice. Montgomery explained the "eating" at Parris Island. He mentioned being examinated and vaccinated. His captain explained to them "they were not sent here to get furloughs, they were sent here to kill men." They arrived at camp the day before and he mentioned their training.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
